name: Celebrate Mother’s Day at Arcadia Earth
description:
We are excited to invite families to celebrate with an immersive experience that combines sustainability, creativity, and unforgettable memories - making it the perfect gift for mom that will keep blooming long after the weekend ends.

Free Pot Painting & Planting Activity: Visitors can paint a mini plant pot, plant a seed, and take home a sustainable keepsake - an activity that’s perfect for families and children.
Running Saturday and Sunday from 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm

Whether you're celebrating moms, grandmas, or any inspiring woman in your life, Arcadia Earth offers a one-of-a-kind, feel-good celebration that’s as unique as it is beautiful.

name: Art Therapy Wellness Workshop
description:
Experience the healing power of creativity. 

Learn how to relieve stress, build confidence, and explore self-expression through guided art activities. No experience needed, just an open mind. Relax, create, and connect in a supportive, safe space.

name: Spring Plant Sale 2025
description:
Discover unique plants from local, trusted growers in a friendly, relaxed shopping environment. Make a day of it—bring your friends, enjoy lunch at the on-site Cafe, and explore our beautiful garden for inspiration.

Highlights:
New Recipe Container Auction 
New Preorder Pickup: Roses, Hydrangeas, Fruit Shrubs, Trees, Conifers 
Natives, Nativars, Pollinator-friendly plants 
Mini Pop-up Market with 10+ vendors 
Garden Advice Clinic by Toronto Master Gardeners 
Free Coffee Chaff from Zavida Coffee 

All proceeds support the Toronto Botanical Garden.

name: Scented Candle Making Workshop
description: Learn a new fun and relaxing skill, and create two beautiful custom candles. Select personalized scents, and work with organic soy wax which burns cleaner and lasts longer. Enjoy them on the same day.

name: Saturday Night Jazz Dinner with The Tanya Wills Quartet
description:
The Tanya Wills Quartet is a Toronto based group consisting of Tanya Wills on vocals, Bill Bridges on guitar, Ron Johnston on bass and Kevin Coady on drums.

An elegant Jazz Combo, the Quartet has an eclectic range of music including jazz/blues, folk and original material. Tanya has recently released her album of original music, entitled “SHE”, to international acclaim.

"It’s clear also that Miss Wills is capable of a flawless performance no matter what the chart because she also works her subtle re-inventions of phrasing and articulation into the material right down to the surprise ending. As a result she produces something joyful and to die for as well.” …Raul da Gama

name: Mother's Day Food Tour
description:
Moms have cooked countless delicious meals for us over the years—now it’s time to treat her to a mix of lunch and adventure on our Food Tour, where she’ll discover new favorites in one of Toronto’s most beloved neighborhoods. 

Kensington Market is a bustling neighbourhood home to an incredible mix of flavors, and we’ve selected the most delicious for you to share together! Whether you’re chowing down on a savory pastry, or enjoying a sweet dessert, this tour is the perfect way to make unforgettable memories this Mother’s Day.

name: ExperienceTO: Swansea Historical Tour
description: Join us for a public tour that will be a good experience for anyone; whether you’re 8 or 80 years old, and whether you’re a curious local, solo traveler, backpacker, part of a small groups of friends, or a newcomer.

name: Community Environment Day at SATEC
description:
Join Councillor Kandavel (Ward 20) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted).

name: Moore Park Tree Planting Event
description:
Join us to create a new naturalized area in Moore Park (North York) by planting native trees and shrubs. 

Event site conditions vary. Contact us for more information including accessibility. If you would like to request accessibility support, contact us as soon as possible.

name: Stuffed Gnocchi Pasta Making Class
description:
Eat, make and enjoy, calling all pasta lovers! 
Join us for a fun-filled, hands-on, and delicious experience! This class is perfect for absolute beginners and foodies alike—no experience necessary, just a love for pasta and a great time!

name: Curiosity In Session
description: Join us for our newest educational initiative. It seeks to facilitate public access to philosophy while increasing public philosophical literacy through alternating bi-weekly Curiosity Classes and Philosophical Skills Workshops.

organizer.name: Being and Becoming: A Community for the Curious

name: Meagan's HUG
description:
Join us for a 5km walk from Hotel X to SickKids to raise awareness for pediatric brain tumours. The proceeds from the HUG is used to fund pediatric brain tumour research at the BTRC at SickKids, the world's largest research centre dedicated to pediatric brain tumours.

The HUG is Meagan Bebenek Foundation (MBF)'s signature event, now in it's 24th year. Through the fundraising efforts at the HUG, in addition to MBF's other initiatives, the Toronto-based non-profit has raised over $6.5 million in paediatric brain tumour research since 2001.

name: Sanctuary Song
description:
From the wilderness to a circus to a zoo.
Based on a true story, Sanctuary Song explores the story of Sydney, an elephant whose remarkable journey culminates in her release into a Tennessee sanctuary.

name: Toronto Tulip Day
description:
The Consulate General of the Kingdom of the Netherlands is pleased to invite you to join us for Toronto Tulip Day. 

To mark the 80th anniversary of the liberation of the Netherlands—a victory that was secured thanks to the courage, sacrifice, and dedicated efforts of Canadian men and women during the Second World War—the Dutch Consulate will be giving out 40,000 tulips to Toronto residents as a living symbol of our heartfelt and enduring gratitude.

The complimentary tulips will be available as long as supplies last.

name: Jazz Night with The Julie McGregor Quartet
description:
Get ready to experience a night filled with rhythm, energy, and heartfelt melodies! Jazz Night is fast approaching, and it promises to be an event you won't want to miss. This popular venue, known for its warm atmosphere, romantic vintage decoration and community vibe, is the perfect place for jazz lovers of all ages. Prepare for an evening rich in captivating performances that will resonate with your spirit and create lasting memories.

 Indulge in delicious food and sip on your favourite cocktails as you gear up for a night filled with incredible jazz.

name: Jubilations of Spring
description:
Celebrate the beauty of the season with a concert led by Music Director Matthew Jones, featuring Schumann’s joyful Spring Symphony and Alice Ho’s vibrant Jubilations of Spring.

Joining the orchestra is guest soprano Natalya Gennadi, performing selections from Estacio’s Filumena, Novello’s We’ll Gather Lilacs in the Spring, and Strauss’s sparkling Die Fledermaus.

An inspiring evening of music, renewal, and springtime magic—don’t miss it!

name: RapidTO: Bathurst Street Public Drop-In Events
description: The City of Toronto and Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) invite residents to learn more and provide feedback on RapidTO: Bathurst Street. Public opinion, along with technical and policy considerations, will be used to inform staff recommendations and decisions made by City Council. Provide feedback by attending a public event, completing the survey, email or phone. The same information will be presented at each public event.

name: Old Chinatown Walking Tour
description: Led by the staff of Mackenzie House museum, this walk will explore the early settlement patterns of the Chinese community in Toronto. Specific focus will be given to Old Chinatown, located in Toronto’s Ward neighbourhood. We will acknowledge unshared histories of Chinese individuals and communities while celebrating Asian Heritage month. While acknowledging the struggles and resiliency of individuals within the community, we will look at the implications of municipal and national policies directed towards the Chinese community.

name: Toronto Police Children's Games
description:
Participants and their siblings are invited to join a fun-filled day of inclusive sports and recreational activities. This event will welcome 200 registrants to join teams led by dedicated Toronto Police volunteers.

Event Schedule:
8:45 am – 9:30 am Registration (Fieldhouse)
10:00 am – 12:30 pm Games (Court 2)
12:30 pm– 2:00 pm Closing and Barbeque

Activities Include:
Wheelchair Basketball
Sitting Volleyball
Boccia and much more!
All registrants will receive a free shirt, an invitation to participate in various games and activities, and a medal to celebrate their achievements!

organizer.name: Variety – the Children’s Charity of Ontario & Variety Village

name: Mother's Day Chocolate Express
description:
Make this Mother’s Day extra special by boarding our Chocolate Express, a one-of-a-kind tasting experience in a charming vintage train car. Let the historic ambiance transport Mom into the world of artisanal Canadian craft chocolate, where she’ll be guided by a chocolate expert through the captivating stories and flavours of chocolate. To top it off, she’ll take home her kit of tasting tools and surplus chocolate so she can recreate the experience and make even more sweet memories.

Note that this event focuses on the darker spectrum of chocolate and is best for those who appreciate quality dark chocolate or are open to broadening their horizons beyond the standard supermarket brands like Lindt and Nestle!

name: Old Chinatown Walking Tour

location.name: Southeast Corner of Yonge and Adelaide Streets

description: Led by the staff of Mackenzie House museum, this walk will explore the early settlement patterns of the Chinese community in Toronto. Specific focus will be given to Old Chinatown, located in Toronto’s Ward neighbourhood. We will acknowledge unshared histories of Chinese individuals and communities while celebrating Asian Heritage month. While acknowledging the struggles and resiliency of individuals within the community, we will look at the implications of municipal and national policies directed towards the Chinese community.

name: Old Chinatown Walking Tour

location.name: Southeast corner of Yonge and Adelaide Streets

description: Led by the staff of Mackenzie House Museum, this walk will explore the early settlement patterns of the Chinese community in Toronto. Specific focus will be given to Old Chinatown, located in Toronto’s Ward neighbourhood. We will acknowledge unshared histories of Chinese individuals and communities while celebrating Asian Heritage month. While acknowledging the struggles and resiliency of individuals within the community, we will look at the implications of municipal and national policies directed towards the Chinese community.

name: Friday Night Western Swing Rockabilly Dinner with Pat Temple and The Hi-Lo Players
description:
A much-loved return performer to the Near North, Pat Temple and his brotherhood of stellar players are gearing up and excited to present their infectious and original music.

Influenced by western swing, jump blues, rockabilly and roadhouse soul, the music is all original yet fits easily into the hearts of those who love traditional roots and folk sensibilities. Pat’s compelling voice and lyrics add the colour to his songs; throw in a little spice of a carnival-barker, and the audience is hooked, and happy!

name: Rogers Road Flower Market
description:
Join us at the Flower Market! We're setting up with a variety of beautiful blooms made possible with the partnership of the Rogers Road BIA, Freshco and the Neighbourhood Officers of 12 Division. A big note of thanks to Freshco as well for their support!

Make your own bouquet for yourself, a friend, or a loved one like Mom. This flower market is meant to be a joyful and delightful event with proceeds benefiting local food banks.
